meanings.definition: A person who has received a license or formal permission to practice a certain profession or trade.
meanings.sent1: The licentiates were skilled professionals in their field.
meanings.sent2: Many licentiates work as doctors or lawyers.
meanings.sent3: The licentiates gathered for a conference to discuss their latest achievements.
meanings.sent4: She was a licentiate of law, wielding knowledge as her weapon.
meanings.sent5: The group of licentiates stood out with their expertise and credentials.

meanings.definition: To grant a license or formal permission to someone.
meanings.sent1: The government licentiates individuals to ensure they meet the required standards.
meanings.sent2: He licentiates businesses to operate legally in the city.
meanings.sent3: The mayor licentiates the new restaurant, allowing it to open its doors.
meanings.sent4: She licentiates artists to showcase their work at the gallery.
meanings.sent5: The board licentiates professionals after thorough evaluation.
